meanings.definition: Aegises: the protection, backing, or support of a particular person or organization.
meanings.sent1: The aegises of the community came together to help the family in need.
meanings.sent2: The company's aegises ensured the success of the charity event.
meanings.sent3: The aegises of the school staff made sure every student had a chance to shine.
meanings.sent4: Her kindness acted as an aegises, shielding those around her from negativity.
meanings.sent5: The aegises of friendship provided comfort during difficult times.

meanings.definition: Aegises: a shield or breastplate emblematic of majesty.
meanings.sent1: The king's aegises were adorned with intricate designs and precious gems.
meanings.sent2: The warrior proudly wore his aegises into battle, a symbol of his strength.
meanings.sent3: The aegises gleamed in the sunlight, catching the eye of all who passed by.
meanings.sent4: Her confidence was her aegises, protecting her from self-doubt.
meanings.sent5: The aegises of royalty were passed down through generations, a legacy of power.
